conclusion: Square wire frame with side length 0.2 m and total resistance 4 Ω
Half of the frame is in a uniform magnetic field perpendicular to the paper (inward)
The magnetic field strength varies with time as B = (3 + 2t) T
The frame remains stationary during the time interval t = 0 to t = 5 s
Need to find the frictional force at t = 2.5 s
Faraday's law of electromagnetic induction applies due to changing magnetic field through stationary conductor
Magnetic field is directed inward (into the page)
Current flows clockwise when viewed from above
Magnetic field at t = 2.5 s is B(2.5) = 8 T
Force on horizontal segments DA and CF is 0.016 N each, directed right and left respectively
No force on vertical segments CD and FA as current is parallel to magnetic field
Net force is zero as forces on DA and CF cancel out
Frictional force required to keep the frame stationary is zero
Final answer: magnitude of frictional force at t = 2.5 s is 0 N
